Habendum.definition: the part of a deed that limits and defines an estate of ownership granted and sometimes the type of tenancy by which the estate is to be held NOTE
Habendum.origin: [New Latin, from Latin, to be had, neuter of habendus , future passive participle of habÄ“re to have, to hold (the first word of this part of the deed)]

1.1: the part of a deed that limits and defines an estate of ownership granted and sometimes the type of tenancy by which the estate is to be held
1.note: The habendum is now often just a formality.
